title: Geometric sans with small caps - suggestions?
content:
I need to find a fresh but classy geometric (or "semi-geometric") sans with small caps for a project. Any good suggestions?

No regular upper/lowercase needed, just small caps.
author: Jan Sandvik

comments.content:
Bryant is too round and Futura is too, well, Futura...

I wish there were some way to test drive the small caps of Proxima Nova and Tangent.
You can see more of Proxima Nova's small caps in Mark Simonson's [PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017024019/http:/www.marksimonson.com/fontspecimens/ProximaNovaFullSpecimen.pdf) (2.2MB)
[Hypatia Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017024019/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/hypatia/hypatia.html) is a freebie if you buy and register Adobe CS3.

Although not strictly a geometric face, especially in lowercase, the small caps of Bliss are, at least, semi-geometric.

[http://www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017024019/http:/www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm "http://www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm")

Tim

Jan,

Send me some copy and I'll set it for you in Tangent small caps

James
